alert.note: Alert for Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 4:32PM PDT until November 05 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grays River near Rosburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect major flooding of lowland areas and roads in the vicinity of Hwy 4 and Rosburg. Numerous road closures are likely. Some buildings in low areas near the river are threatened with flooding above this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM PDT Friday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 PM PDT Friday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to major flood stage of 16.3 feet between 4 and 5 pm this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling on Saturday. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM PDT.
